cluster_relations.rel_desc: The Book of the Dead is meant to help the deceased person navigate the afterlife.
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Practices and Burials
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Religion and Culture

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: UsageContext: funerary ritual and post-mortem journey

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The Book of the Dead is intended to help the deceased reach the realm of the gods.
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Practices and Burials
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Ancient Egyptian Afterlife Beliefs and Concepts
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Religion and Culture

qualifiers.TemporalQualifier: after successful navigation of the afterlife
qualifiers.SpatialQualifier: toward the realm of the gods

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject (typically a text, object, or practice) is employed with the functional purpose of benefiting or enabling the object (a person, state, or outcome).
args.justification: Both relations describe the functional purpose of the Book of the Dead: it is employed to help the deceased person and to help them reach the realm of the gods. These are consistent usage/purpose links where the text is used as a means to achieve or benefit the object.

Both instances connect a ritual text to the intended function or purpose it serves (helping the deceased, enabling access to the realm of the gods). They belong to the same family of relations expressing what something is for or what purpose it serves.

These relations describe how the Book of the Dead is used and what practical/teleological role it plays, fitting the broad category of usage or function rather than composition, identity, or causality.
